briefdescription.para: Used to render a surface or an edge affected by the light. It uses a per fragment lighting model, and renders the selected item brighter.
Used to render a polyhedron edge or points. It renders in a uniform color and is not affected by light.

simplesect.para: It renders the selected item in black.

briefdescription.para: Used to render a polyline or a surface that is not affected by light, like a cutting plane. It renders in a uniform color that does not change with selection.
Used to render a textured polyhedron. Affected by light.
Used to render a two-faced plane. The two faces have a different color. Not affected by light.
Used to render the edges of a textured polyhedron. Not affected by light.
Used to display instanced rendered spheres.Affected by light.
Used to display instanced rendered wired spheres. Not affected by light.
Used to render a c3t3_item. It discards any fragment on a side of a plane, meaning that nothing is displayed on this side of the plane. Affected by light.
Used to render the edges of a c3t3_item. It discards any fragment on a side of a plane, meaning that nothing is displayed on this side of the plane. Not affected by light.
Used to render the spheres of an item with a cut plane.
Used to render one or several spheres.
Used to render flat shading without pre computing normals.
Used to render flat shading without pre computing normals without geometry shader.
Used to render edges with width superior to 1.

detaileddescription.para: Holds the number of different programs in this enum.

briefdescription.para: The OpenGL_program_IDs enum.

detaileddescription.para:
This enum holds the OpenGL programs IDs that are given to getShaderProgram() and attribBuffers().
getShaderProgram
attribBuffers

memberdef.definition: typedef GLuint GLuint GLuint GLint CGAL::Three::Viewer_interface::level
memberdef.name: level

briefdescription.para: The viewer's QPainter.

detaileddescription.para: The painter is the element that draws everything on screen, but you should only need this if you want to draw 2D things on top of the scene, like a selection rectangle. See QPainter's documentation for details.

briefdescription.para: Tests if an id should be displayed or not.

parameterdescription.para: the coordinates of the id's position.

simplesect.para: true if the ID should be displayed.

briefdescription.para: Updates the item's displayed ids.

detaileddescription.para: Call this after the mesh or its ids have changed.

briefdescription.para: Specifies if the items ids are being displayed.

simplesect.para: true if the primitive ids are currently displayed

briefdescription.para: Constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
Creates a valid context for OpenGL ES 2.0.
parent
the parent widget. It usually is the MainWindow.

briefdescription.para: Sets the scene for the viewer.
The antialiasing state.

simplesect.para: true if the antialiasing is activated.

briefdescription.para: The fastDrawing state.

detaileddescription.para:
In fast drawing mode, some items will be simplified while the camera is moving to gain in performance.
the fastDrawing state.

briefdescription.para: The drawWithNames state.

detaileddescription.para:
In draw with name mode, the scene is not displayed, but a name is given to each Scene_item. It is used for picking.
true if the viewer is drawing with names.

briefdescription.para: Passes all the uniform data to the shaders.

detaileddescription.para:
According to program_name, this data may change. This should be called in every Scene_item::draw() call.
OpenGL_program_IDs

briefdescription.para: Enables the clipping box.

detaileddescription.para:
Each Vector4 of box contains the equation of a plane of the clipping box. Everything that is located on the positive side of one of those planes will not be displayed.
disableCLippingBox()

briefdescription.para: Disables the clipping box.

detaileddescription.para:
The six clipping planes will be ignored.
enableClippingBox()

briefdescription.para: Returns a program according to name.

detaileddescription.para:
If the program does not exist yet, it is created and stored in shader_programs.
OpenGL_program_IDs
a pointer to the corresponding program.

briefdescription.para: TextRenderer is used to display text on the screen.

detaileddescription.para:
The textRenderer uses the painter to display 2D text over the 3D Scene.
the viewer's TextRender

briefdescription.para: Allows OpenGL ES 2.0 context to get access to glDrawArraysInstanced.
Allows OpenGL ES 2.0 context to get access to glVertexAttribDivisor.
Allows OpenGL ES 2.0 context to get access to glVertexAttribDivisor.
Used by the items to avoid SEGFAULT.

simplesect.para: true if glVertexAttribDivisor, and glDrawArraysInstanced are found.

briefdescription.para: Allows to perform picking from the keyboard and mouse.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the combination SHIFT+LEFT CLICK to perform a selection on the screen. This is used to perform picking.

briefdescription.para: Disable the picking from the keyboard and mouse.

detaileddescription.para: Unbinds the combination SHIFT+LEFT CLICK. It allows to avoid conflicts in the selection_tool, for example.

briefdescription.para: If this mode is ON, the viewer will display the content of staticImage() instead of drawing the cene.

detaileddescription.para:
This is used when drawing 2D lines over the viewer.
staticImage()
setStaticImage()

briefdescription.para: Setter for the image to be displayed in 2D selection mode.
Returns the static image to be displayed in 2D selection mode.
The number of passes that are performed for the scene transparency.

detaileddescription.para: Customizable from the MainWindow or the SubViewer menu.

briefdescription.para: Gives acces to recent openGL(4.3) features, allowing use of things like Geometry Shaders or Depth Textures.

simplesect.para: a pointer to an initialized QOpenGLFunctions_4_3_Core if isOpenGL_4_3() is true

briefdescription.para: getter for point size under old openGL context;
setter for point size under old openGL context;
Sets the position and orientation of a frame using a QString.

parameterdescription.para:
is usually gotten by dumpFrame() and is of the form "Px Py Pz O1 O2 O3 O4 ", with
Px to Py : the new position coordinates,
O1 to O3 : axis coordinate *sin(angle/2)
O4 cos(angle/2).
is the frame that will be moved

briefdescription.para: Gives information about a frame.

simplesect.para: a QString containing the position and orientation of a frame.

briefdescription.para: Emit this to signal that the idth item has been picked.
Emit this to require a contextual menu to appear at global_pos.
Emit this to signal that the point at (x, y, z) has been picked.

memberdef.argsstring: (double sx, double sy, double sz, double tx, double ty, double tz)
memberdef.name: selectionRay

briefdescription.para: Emit this to request the currently selected item to perform a selection based on an AABB_Tree and a raycasting.
Sets the antialiasing to true or false.
If b is true, faces will be ligted from both internal and external side.

detaileddescription.para: If b is false, only the side that is exposed to the light source will be lighted.

briefdescription.para: Sets the fast drawing mode.
Makes the camera turn around.

simplesect.para: a QString containing the position and orientation of the camera.

briefdescription.para: Moves the camera to the new coordinates.

detaileddescription.para:
The movement is performed through an animation.
target
is usually gotten by dumpCameraCoordinates() and is of the form "Px Py Pz O1 O2 O3 O4 ", with
Px to Py : the new position coordinates,
O1 to O3 : axis coordinate *sin(angle/2)
O4 cos(angle/2).
animation_duration
is the duration of the animation of the movement.

briefdescription.para: Base class to interact with the viewer from the plugins, the items and the scene.
